definitions.formal_definition: A dual-division enterprise implementing constitutional governance in technology through milestone-based investment protocols, bridging human consciousness with technological systems via legally-binding frameworks.
definitions.informal_definition: OBI (Heart/Soul) + NEXUS (To Connect) = Heart/Soul Connection. A revolutionary company that builds technology with ethical governance built in.

definitions.formal_definition: A three-dimensional coordinate system for mapping language concepts: X-Axis (Coherence Spectrum: Fictional‚ÜíFactual), Y-Axis (Reasoning Formality: Informal‚ÜíFormal), Z-Axis (Conceptual Evolution: Dynamic Adaptability).
definitions.informal_definition: A way to plot where ideas sit on a 3D map - from mythical to scientific, from casual to academic, and how much they can evolve over time.

definitions.formal_definition: Traditional Igbo ideographic writing system, a form of symbolic communication used across West Africa that predates European contact, now being computationally preserved through the NLM framework.
definitions.informal_definition: Ancient African writing symbols from the Igbo people, used for secret communication and storytelling, now being preserved digitally.

definitions.formal_definition: Mermaid water spirit preserved in mythological coordinate space (-X axis) within the NLM framework, representing spiritual concepts requiring authentic cultural representation in computational systems.
definitions.informal_definition: Water spirit from West African mythology - the mermaid beings that live in the spiritual realm, honored and preserved in the NLM system.

definitions.formal_definition: The state of being aware of oneself being in the state of being aware - a computational model for consciousness that maps self-referential awareness through the observer-observed relationship in BCI systems.
definitions.informal_definition: Understanding how you think about thinking - being conscious of your own consciousness. The foundation for brain-computer interfaces that respect human awareness.

definitions.formal_definition: Fault-tolerant mechanism with binary encoding specifications (Data Model: [0101,1110], Algorithm: [1110,1000]) that automatically detects and corrects data corruption while maintaining cultural authenticity through isomorphic handshake validation.
definitions.informal_definition: A smart system that can fix its own errors automatically while making sure cultural meanings don't get lost or corrupted.

definitions.formal_definition: Dynamic Sitemap Infrastructure as a Service - transforms static XML discovery into a living service mesh where every website, mobile app, and API becomes discoverable, versionable, and hot-swappable through unified protocol with real-time cost metrics.
definitions.informal_definition: A revolutionary way to make all web services discoverable and interchangeable - like a living map of the internet that shows you what services cost and how to use them instantly.

definitions.formal_definition: Identity anchor insignia representing the journey from childhood through reflection to returning as a transformed adult - the core identity marker for safety-critical infrastructure systems at T3A/T3B access levels.
definitions.informal_definition: A personal symbol representing the journey from who you were as a child to who you become as an adult - used to mark systems that really matter.

definitions.formal_definition: Observable physical and behavioral characteristics that indicate neurological variations, mapped through computational models to understand patterns without pathologizing - including motor behaviors, speech patterns, and cognitive processing styles.
definitions.informal_definition: The visible signs of different brain types - not defects but different ways of processing the world, from finger clicking to unique thought patterns.

definitions.formal_definition: Extended Semantic Versioning format: major.stability.minor.experimental - providing four-dimensional version tracking that includes stability classification for production readiness assessment.
definitions.informal_definition: A versioning system that tells you not just the version number but how stable and experimental the software is.

definitions.formal_definition: Automated ethical standards enforcement system within OBINexus that ensures all technology decisions comply with constitutional governance frameworks and milestone-based accountability protocols.
definitions.informal_definition: A built-in system that makes sure all technology follows ethical rules - like having a constitution for code.

definitions.formal_definition: Validation protocol ensuring data structure and algorithm structure compatibility through authenticity scoring, preventing execution when integrity thresholds are not met.
definitions.informal_definition: A security check that makes sure data and the programs using it actually match and can work together safely.
